brands.description: Manage your brand library, including brand information, status, and associated products.

help.title: Help
help.brandManagement: You can add and edit brand information, manage brand status, and perform bulk operations.
help.nameAndSlugDescription: are required fields. URL identifier will be auto-generated but can also be customized.
help.logoDescription: Supports upload or external URL, square images recommended.
help.statusDescription: Controls whether the brand is displayed on the frontend website.
help.popularDescription: When set, the brand will appear in the frontend popular brands list.
help.bulkOperationsDescription: After selecting multiple brands, you can perform bulk activate, deactivate, set popular, unset popular, or delete operations.

bulkActions.title: Bulk Actions
bulkActions.confirmDeleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the selected {count} brands? This action cannot be undone.
bulkActions.bulkUnsetPopularSuccess: Successfully removed popular status from {count} brands
bulkActions.noSelection: Please select brands to operate on first

drawer.addDescription: Fill the form below to add a new brand
drawer.addHelpText: After adding, you can edit brand information or manage its status at any time
drawer.nameHint: The official name of the brand, which will be displayed on the website
drawer.slugDescription: Used to generate the brand page URL, only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens are allowed
drawer.logoPlaceholder: Upload brand logo or enter URL
drawer.logoHint: It is recommended to upload a square PNG or SVG format, no larger than 2MB
drawer.websiteHint: The brand's official website link, which users can click to visit
drawer.descriptionPlaceholder: Briefly describe the brand's features, history, or positioning...
drawer.descriptionHint: Optional, helps users understand the brand
drawer.statusActiveDesc: The brand is active and will be displayed on the frontend for users to browse
drawer.statusInactiveDesc: The brand is inactive and will not be displayed on the frontend
drawer.popularityActiveDesc: Set as a popular brand, will be prioritized for display in the 'Popular Brands' section on the frontend brand list page.
drawer.popularityInactiveDesc: A regular brand, displayed in normal order
drawer.tip1: Only active brands will be displayed on the frontend
drawer.tip2: Popular brands will be prioritized for display on the homepage and category pages
drawer.tip3: These settings can be changed at any time

brands.title: Brand Management

preview.title: Brand Preview
preview.description: View the detailed information of the brand

categories.statusUpdateSuccessDesc: Category {name} status has been updated to {status}.
categories.showInNavbarTooltip: Controls if this sub-category is displayed in the main site navigation
categories.showInNavbarUpdateSuccessDesc: Navbar visibility for category "{name}" has been updated to "{status}".

validation.parentRequiredDesc: Level 2 or 3 categories must have a parent category.

help.title: Category Logic Guide
help.description: Understand our three-tier category system to better organize your products
help.level1Purpose: Used to distinguish products for different gender or age groups
help.level2Examples: Examples: Tops, Bottoms, Shoes, Accessories, Bags
help.level2Purpose: Must select a parent Level 1 category, used for broad product classification
help.level3Examples: Examples: T-Shirts, Shirts, Jeans, Sneakers, Watches
help.level3Purpose: Must select both Level 1 and Level 2 categories, used for detailed product classification
help.exampleStructure:
Men's > Tops > T-Shirts
Women's > Shoes > High Heels
Kids' > Bottoms > Jeans
help.bestPractice1: • Ensure category names are concise and clear
help.bestPractice2: • Use lowercase letters and hyphens for URL-friendly slugs
help.bestPractice3: • Level 2 categories can be set to display in navigation bar
help.bestPractice4: • Create Level 1 categories first, then gradually add Level 2 and 3
help.navbarVisibilityDesc: Level 2 categories can be set to display in the website's main navigation bar to help users quickly find products
help.structureInfo: Categories use a three-level structure: <level1>Gender</level1> → <level2>Product Type</level2> → <level3>Sub-type</level3>. Click category name to edit, hover to show actions.

categories.title: Category Management
categories.description: Manage your product categories with multi-level support.
categories.createDescription: Create appropriate category levels for your product structure.
categories.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete category "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.

discounts.description: Manage FMTC and other discount sources with automatic expiration handling and brand matching

codeSnippets.createSnippetDescription: Add a new custom code snippet to your website.
codeSnippets.deleteConfirmationMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the code snippet "{name}"? This action cannot be undone and the code will be removed from your website.
codeSnippets.description: Add, edit, and manage custom JS or CSS code snippets injected into the website frontend.

form.codeDescription: Enter your JavaScript or CSS code.
form.descriptionPlaceholder: Briefly explain what this snippet does
form.nameDescription: Give this snippet a recognizable name.
form.pathsDescription: Specify on which page paths this snippet should be active. Use * as wildcard. Leave empty for all pages.
form.pathsPlaceholder:
One path pattern per line, e.g.:
/products/*
/about
/ (for homepage)
form.statusDescription: Controls whether this snippet is active on the frontend.

startUrls.description: The scraper will start crawling from these URLs. Enter one URL per line.

cronExpression.label: CRON Expression (Optional)
cronExpression.description: If set, the task will run on this CRON schedule. Leave empty for no schedule.

isEnabled.label: Enable Task
isEnabled.description: If disabled, the task will not run on schedule and cannot be triggered via API.

debugModeEnabled.label: Enable Debug Development Mode
debugModeEnabled.description: If enabled, task execution logs will also be saved to the local file system for development and debugging purposes.

scheduler.title: Auto Scheduler
scheduler.description: Configure automatic expiry check and data cleanup functions
scheduler.enabledDescription: Automatically check and mark expired discounts
scheduler.intervalDescription: Set the time interval for automatic checks (1-1440 minutes)
scheduler.cleanupDescription: Automatically delete expired data beyond retention period
scheduler.retentionDescription: Retention days for expired data (1-365 days)

notifications.title: Threshold Notifications
notifications.description: Configure data volume threshold monitoring and notification functions
notifications.criticalDescription: Send critical warning when below this quantity
notifications.warningDescription: Send warning reminder when below this quantity

brandMatching.title: Brand Matching
brandMatching.autoMatchDescription: Automatically try to match brands when importing

import.title: FMTC Discount Data Import
import.description: Supports pasting FMTC copied discount information or uploading TSV/CSV files. The system will automatically parse data and intelligently match brands.
import.pasteDescription: Supports table format (tab-separated) or plain text format. The system will automatically identify format and parse.
import.pastePlaceholder:
Please paste FMTC discount information...

Example format:
Gap CA	Extra 20% Off Purchase	ADDON	06/25/25 10:45am PDT	06/25/25 12:00pm PDT	07/03/25 11:59pm PDT	24.5
import.previewDescription: After confirming the data is correct, click the import button to start batch importing discount information
